author: Carissa Holder

review: I like the Fire TV stick overall. The remote is a nice relief because I don't always love grabbing my phone or tablet to switch something on the program I'm watching. I'm giving it a 4 because it's a bit wonky (like Roku, which is to say sometimes it works well and other times not so much, unless I unplug it and start all over) and therefore less stable than Chromecast. Whereas I get the added advantage of Amazon Prime shows and a few of my vital "go to" apps like Netflix and YouTube, I miss HBOGo. That has more to do with HBO and Amazon than with the stick but it would be nice to have one streaming device to control them all. Overall, I like the stick but think it needs work in terms of stability. I switched to Chromecast to avoid the whole unplug, reset drama I encountered with Roku. And YES, I use the USB cable and it's still not that stable and I would blame my tv but for the Chromecast working without incident.
